title: Fresh Air Remembers Former U.S. Poet Laureate Philip Levine
teaser: Levine's work often reflected the hardships and dignity of manual labor. He died Feb. 14 in Fresno, Calif. He was 87. In 1991, Levine spoke with Terry Gross about his collection What Work Is.
contentencoded: Copyright 2015 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
